channel.title: [CZAR]Username Capitalization
channel.description: When someone logs in or something it would say for example "Player tony has logged in". How can I make the 'T' in 'tony' capitalized? What code would I need to add in client.java?

item.title: [CZAR]Username Capitalization
item.dc:creator: @gangsta_tony gangsta tony
item.description:
@gangsta_tony wrote:

I got this error

client.java:11678: cannot find symbol symbol : variable text location: class client Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)); ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.title: [CZAR]Username Capitalization
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:


Here is an example of yelling in an old server that would capitalize the name and the first letter of your sentence:

[code]PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "[Player] - " + playerName + ":  " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1);[/code]

Here is an example of yelling in an old server that would capitalize the name and the first letter of your sentence:

Read full topic

item.title: [CZAR]Username Capitalization
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“IlikeArrays, post:2, topic:388975”]http://download.oracle.com/javase/1.4.2/docs/api/java/lang/String.html

String toUpperCase()
Converts all of the characters in this String to upper case using the rules of the default locale.

I WOULD MAKE IT LIKE THIS TBH[/quote]
I don’t think he asked that at all.

Read full topic
